title: [BUG] DummyForecaster interface is inconsistent
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
`DummyForecaster` does not adhere to the forecaster interface. The forecast horizon is given to `fit` and the predictions are calculated in this method instead of in `predict`. This prevents your from using this forecaster in the same interfaces and pipelines as everything else.

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. 
https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link
it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
def do_forecast(ts, fcstr, test_size=20):
    train, test = ts[:-test_size], ts[-test_size:]
    fh = np.arange(len(test)) + 1
    
    fcstr.fit(train)
    fcstr.predict(fh=fh)
    
data = load_airline()

fcstrs = [
    ThetaForecaster(),
    ExpSmoothingForecaster(),
    ARIMAForecaster(),
    DummyForecaster()
]
for fcstr in fcstrs:
    # ValueError: DummyForecaster requires to specify the forecasting horizon in `fit`
    do_forecast(data, fcstr)
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
`DummyForecaster.fit()` should not require a forecast horizon. Predictions should be done in `DummyForecaster.predict()`.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
